Fly Me to the Moon
Mankind's Journey to the Stars

A look at mankind's journey to the stars, from 1955 to today and beyond

In 1955, in the space of a week, both the United States and USSR announced their intentions to put man-made satellites into orbit. Thus began the Space Race, which would, within 15 years, see man standing on the surface of the moon, and lead to the the greatest era of exploration ever entered in to by mankind.

This is that story.
